article_title: HCA shares slump after bad debt provision increased
article_text:
HCA shares slump after bad debt provision increased

Photo: Associated Press File Photo HCA, based in Nashville, Tennessee, raised its provision for...

HCA Holdings Inc., fell the most in more than five months after the for-profit U.S. hospital chain increased its provision for bad debt before partially recovering in the afternoon.

article_metadata.description: While millions of people have gained coverage since Obamacare became law in 2010, there’s also been an increase in insurance costs that comes with high deductibles and cost sharing.  At HCA, the concerns over provisions for bad debt overshadowed first-quarter earnings that exceeded analysts’ estimates and a raised forecast for 2016.
article_metadata.author.name: By John Lauerman, Bloomberg News
